definition: to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

sentences.english: "Who dare bully my son?! "Father leads Son by the hand out ot the house.
sentences.chinese: “誰敢欺負我的乖兒子？”爸爸牽着兒子就往外走。

sentences.english: I said good-night and went out.
sentences.chinese: 我向他們說了聲晚安就往外走。

sentences.english: Then the fire alarm went off. I just grabbed my clothes and ran out.
sentences.chinese: 當時火險警報器響了，我一把抓起衣服就往外跑。

sentences.english: Fire is good merchandise, credit is a collective, once pressed the library, pay out compensation.
sentences.chinese: 火了是好貨，功勞屬集體，一旦壓了庫，工資往外賠。

sentences.english: From my apartment window, everything I see looks quite small.
sentences.chinese: 從我公寓的窗戶往外看，所有的物事都很小。

sentences.english: Numbly , he watched through one of the windows.
sentences.chinese: 他呆呆地透過一個窗戶往外看著。

sentences.english: In his opinion, continuing to pay rent each month for his apartment is just pouring money down the drain.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲，繼續給付房屋租金就是將錢向水一樣往外潑。

sentences.english: View from the very corner of the rock.
sentences.chinese: 從岩石最裏面的角落往外看到的景色。

sentences.english: For at the window of my house I looked through my casement
sentences.chinese: 我曾在我房屋的窗戶內，從我窗櫺之間，往外觀看。

sentences.english: Open your hand and hold your fingers out straight as you see me doing, and then pull.
sentences.chinese: 跟着我做，張開你的手，伸直手指，然後用力往外拉。

sentences.english: The film was over. The students poured out in crowds.
sentences.chinese: 電影散場後學生們一羣一羣往外湧。

sentences.english: So they dance off in a row.
Who?' Two or three eunuchs looked down at him.
sentences.chinese: 有兩三個太監從窗戶往外看他。

sentences.english: I watched it from my room.
NY】Chinese children looked out from their classroom in a rural primary school in Gansu Province.
sentences.chinese: 在甘肅省一所農村小學，孩子們正從教室往外望去。

sentences.english: I said 'I have to get out of here 'cause I'm choking, ' but there were so many people behind me that I couldn't get out.
sentences.chinese: 我很想往外跑，但是商場里人太多了，我根本出不去。

definition: to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
to get up/to leave/to set forth
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
to turn one's head/to turn around
to get into/to dig into (studies, job etc)/to squeeze into
relevant/to the point/has sth to do with the matter (also used with negative)
